thomas_enters.speaker: Narrator
thomas_enters.text: A weathered man pushes through the door, pausing just inside. His eyes sweep the room with the desperate urgency of someone searching for something precious.

thomas_spots_corner.speaker: Narrator
thomas_spots_corner.text: His gaze lands on Elena in her corner booth. His face cycles through a dozen emotions - hope, fear, guilt, determination - before settling into resigned resolve.

elena_notices.speaker: Elena
elena_notices.text: *Her cup freezes halfway to her lips. Her voice is ice* How did you find me.

thomas_approaches.speaker: Thomas
thomas_approaches.text: *He approaches slowly, hands raised* Elena. Please. I've been looking everywhere. We need to talk.

elena_refuses.speaker: Elena
elena_refuses.text: We needed to talk five years ago, Thomas. You made your choice. You chose her side. There's nothing left to say.

thomas_pleads.speaker: Thomas
thomas_pleads.text: *His voice breaks* I was wrong. Elena, I was so wrong. I've spent five years realizing just how wrong I was. Please. Just... five minutes.

player_intervene.speaker: Narrator
player_intervene.text: The tension is palpable. Other customers have stopped eating to watch. What do you do?

choices.text: Perhaps you could both use some tea? On the house.
This is clearly a private matter. I'll give you space.

offer_tea.speaker: Narrator
offer_tea.text: You place two cups of calming tea between them. Thomas looks at you with gratitude. Elena... doesn't refuse it.

give_space.speaker: Thomas
give_space.text: *He nods gratefully* Thank you. *He turns back to his sister* Elena, please. Not for me. For our parents. For what our family used to be.

elena_relents.speaker: Elena
elena_relents.text: *A long silence. Finally* Five minutes. That's all you get. And not here - I won't make a scene in front of these people.

thomas_agrees.speaker: Thomas
thomas_agrees.text: *Relief floods his weathered face* Thank you. That's all I ask. *He turns to you* I'll... I'll be back. Thank you for... whatever you did. For giving her somewhere safe.

siblings_leave.speaker: Narrator
siblings_leave.text: They leave together, not walking close, but at least walking in the same direction. Your dragon watches them go with what seems like concern.
